title: Rome mayor election: Can Rome be rescued from the rubbish?
description: The picture-postcard capital is beloved by tourists but plagued by problems beneath the façade.

title: Straight-talking rappers tackle Middle East conflict
description: Jew Uriya Rosenman and Arab Sameh Zakout expose hidden prejudices on both sides in their hit song.

title: Randall Goosby: Violinist champions music by black composers
description: Randall Goosby is a rising star of classical music, who performed at the 9/11 memorial ceremony.

title: 'The black sporting heroes who changed our lives'
description: BBC Sport takes a look at some of the black sporting heroes who simply meant everything to us, changed our lives and made us fall in love with sport.

title: Restaurants warn prices will rise due to VAT hike
description: The increased sales tax will be passed on to customers, say restaurant and bar bosses.

title: Is Biden's biggest win about to elude him?
description: A series of spending packages have put the White House and the Democrats in crisis mode this week.

title: What is redundancy and what are my rights?
description: If you've lost your job, here is a guide to your financial entitlements.

title: Sarah Everard murder: Wayne Couzens handed whole-life sentence
description: It means Wayne Couzens will never be released after his abduction, rape and murder of Sarah Everard.

title: Sarah Everard: How Wayne Couzens covered up her murder
description: Wayne Couzens is jailed for life for his carefully planned attack on a victim he chose at random.

title: Judge refuses to delay Scots vaccine passport scheme
description: Nightclub bosses fail in a legal challenge which sought to delay Scotland's vaccine passport scheme.

title: Furlough scheme ends with almost 1 million left in limbo
description: Firms still relying on the scheme, which has protected the wages of millions, call for support as it closes.

title: Britney Spears: Singer 'on cloud nine' after conservatorship ruling
description: The singer posted footage of her flying a plane after a judge suspended her father as conservator.

title: Ecuador riot: Police storm jail where 116 died in gang war
description: Neighbours report hearing explosions at a prison where scores of inmates were killed on Tuesday.

title: Killamarsh: Families 'left broken' by deaths of woman and children
description: Terri Harris and her children John Paul and Lacey Bennett were found dead along with Connie Gent.

title: IOC to investigate Belarus coaches accused of trying to send athlete home from Tokyo
description: An investigation has been opened into two Belarus coaches who allegedly tried to force an athlete to fly home from the Tokyo Olympics.

title: JK Rowling table saved from cafe gutted by fire
description: The antique that sections of the Harry Potter books were written on is now being taken to a restorer.

title: Insulate Britain protesters glue hands to M25
description: Nine arrests are made on the eighth day of action on the motorway in the last three weeks.

title: Rapid house price growth continues in September, says Nationwide
description: Property prices have risen at 10% or more a year for each of the last five months, the Nationwide says.

title: Danish museum wants artist to pay back money after producing blank canvasses
description: The artist was given around $83,000 to recreate old artworks, but then produced two blank canvasses.

title: Osi Umenyiora & Jason Bell debate which is more important in the NFL, talent or coaching
description: Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell debate which is more important, talent or coaching, after Aaron Rodgers led his Green Bay Packers team to a last-minute win over the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Face-to-face GP visits still near lockdown levels
description: Surgeries in England say remote consultations are the only option as they do not have enough staff.

title: Elise Christie: British speed skater says she was raped aged 19
description: British Olympic speed skater Elise Christie says she was raped when she was 19 - and now wants to help others.

title: Fury 'absolutely wounded' by Joshua loss
description: Tyson Fury says he was "absolutely wounded" that British heavyweight rival Anthony Joshua lost the WBA, WBO and IBF titles to Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Exams: Covid grade inflation to be wound back over two years
description: GCSE and A-level grades in England will be returned to pre-Covid levels over the next two years, ministers say.

title: Liverpool v Manchester City: Watch Match of the Day's rewind of Reds' 4-3 win in 2018
description: Was this the best Liverpool v Manchester City game in recent years? Relive the Reds' 4-3 win at Anfield in 2018 before the sides' Premier League encounter on Sunday.

title: James Bond and MI6: Is there fact in fiction?
description: As the Bond film is released, some of Britain's real-life spies reveal something of life inside MI6.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Sarah didn't stand a chance' and 'women lose trust'
description: Thursday's papers lead with details of the murder of Sarah Everard who was abducted in London earlier this year.

title: Climate change: Money on the agenda at Milan talks
description: After the jeers of Greta Thunberg, minsters meet in Italy for the last UN talks before a major climate summit.

title: Covid: Lockdown and the cost of cancelled physio sessions
description: Long-term cancellation of physiotherapy sessions are having a detrimental impact on peoples' lives.
